conbody.p: List of video content data, including context data values, that Adobe collects via solution variables.

ul.li: Label: The name of the parameter.

Implementation: Information on implementation values and requirements
Key - Variable, set either manually in your app, or automatically by the Adobe VHL SDK.
Required - Indicates whether the parameter is required for basic video tracking.
Type - Specifies the type of the variable to be set, string or number.
Sent With - Indicates when the data is sent: Initiate is the analytics call sent on video start, Ad Start is the analytics call sent on ad start, Chapter Start is the analytics call sent on chapter start, and Close is the compiled analytics call sent directly from the heartbeat server to the analytics server at the end of the video session, or the end of the ad. The Close calls are not available in network packet calls.
Min. SDK Version - Indicates which SDK version you would need to access the parameter.
Sample Value - Provides example of common variable usage.

Network Parameters: Displays the values that are passed to Adobe Analytics or Heartbeat servers. This column shows the names of the parameters that are seen in the network calls generated by Adobe VHL SDKs.

Reporting: Information on how to view and analyze the video data.
Available - Indicates whether the data is available in reporting by default (Yes), or requires custom set-up (Custom)
Reserved Variable - Indicates whether the data is captured as an event, eVar, prop, or classification in a reserved variable.
Report Name - Name of Adobe Aanlytics report for variable
Context Data - Name of the Adobe Analytics context data passed to the reporting server and used in processing rules.
Data Feed - Column name for variable found in Clickstream or Live Stream data feeds
Audience Manager - Trait name found in Adobe Audience Manager

entry.p: Label
Implementation
Network Parameters
Reporting

ul.li: Report Name: Video Name, or Video Name (variable)

entry.p: This is the "friendly" (human-readable) name of the video, equal to the last value of s:asset:name.
In reporting, "Video Name" is the classification and "Video Name (variable)" is the eVar.
Content ID of the content, which can be used to tie back to other industry / CMS IDs, equal to the last value of s:asset:video_id. Any integer and/or letter combination.

Clip Length/Runtime - This is the maximum length (or duration) of the content being consumed (in seconds). It equals the last value of l:asset:length from events of type Main. If l:asset:length is not set, then the last value of l:asset:duration is used.

p.note: This property is used to compute several metrics, such as progress tracking metrics and Average Minute Audience. If this is not set, or not greater than zero, then these metrics are not available.

entry.p: For Live videos with an unknown duration, the value of 86400 is the default.
In Reporting, "Video Length" is the classification and "Video Length (variable)" is the eVar.
** Pre Version 1.5.1, this was l:asset:duration; after 1.5.1, this is l:asset:length.
Restricted to three values: streamType.VOD, streamType.LIVE, or streamType.LINEAR.
This equals s:stream:type. If that is unset, this equals missing_content_type.
This identifies an instance of a content stream unique to an individual playback.
Name of the player.
Distribution Station/Channels or where the content is played. Any string value is accepted here.
The interval that describes the part of the content that has been viewed (in minutes). The segment is computed as min and max of the playhead values during a playback session.
Ability to track path of viewer across site and/or App to see path they took to view a particular video. Any integer and/or letter combination.

The SDK version used by the player. This could have any custom value that makes sense for your player. Customers will have to create their own processing rules to have the value available for reporting.
The heartbeat SDK version used for the tracking session. Customers will have to create their own processing rules to have the value available for reporting.
* MediaHeartbeat.version();
Label
Implementation
Network Parameters
Reporting
Program/Series Name

p.note: Program Name is required only if the show is part of a series.

entry.p: Format of the stream (Live, VOD, Linear).

ul.li: Sample value: "2" (an integer representing the season number)

entry.p: The season number the show belongs to.
entry.note: Season Series is required only if the show is part of a series.

ul.li: Sample value: "13" (an integer representing the episode number)

entry.p: The number of the episode.

ul.li: Sample value: "89745363" (any integer and/or letter combination)

entry.p: This is the unique identifier for the content of the video asset, such as the TV series episode identifier, movie asset identifier, or live event identifier. Typically these IDs are derived from metadata authorities such as EIDR, TMS/Gracenote, or Rovi. These identifiers can also be from other proprietary or in-house systems.
Type or grouping of content as defined by content producer.
The date when the content first aired on television. Any date format is acceptable, but Adobe recommends: YYYY-MM-DD
The date when the content first aired on any digital channel or platform. Any date format is acceptable but Adobe recommends: YYYY-MM-DD

ul.li: Sample value: TVY, TVG, TVPG, TVMA, etc.

entry.p: Rating as defined by TV Parental Guidelines.
Creator of the content.
The network/channel name.
Type of content, expressed as an integer between 0 and 3.
MVPD provided via Adobe authentication.
The user has been authorized via AdobePass.
entry.note: This can only be true if it is set. If it is not set, no value is returned.

entry.p: A property that defines the time of the day when the content was broadcast or played. This could have any value set as necessary by customers.
Type of feed.
Label
Implementation
Network Parameters
Reporting
Load event for the video. (This occurs when the viewer clicks the Play button). This would count even if there are pre-roll ads, buffering, errors, and so on.
entry.note: This can only be true if it is set. If it is not set, no value is returned.

entry.p: First frame of video is viewed. If viewer drops during ad, buffering, etc., then there would be no "Content Start" event.
entry.note: This can only be true if it is set. If it is not set, no value is returned.

entry.p: A stream that was watched to completion - This does not necessarily mean the viewer watched the whole video; viewer could have skipped ahead. This only means viewer reached the end of the video, 100%.
entry.note: This can only be true if it is set. If it is not set, no value is returned.

entry.p: Sums the event duration (in seconds) for all events of type PLAY on the main content.
Sums the event duration (in seconds) for all events of type PLAY, both main and ad content.
Playhead passes the 10% marker of video based on video length. The marker is only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.
entry.note: This can only be true if it is set. If it is not set, no value is returned.

entry.p: Playhead passes the 25% marker of video based on video length. Marker only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.
entry.note: This can only be true if it is set. If it is not set, no value is returned.

entry.p: Playhead passes the 50% marker of video based on video length. Marker only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.
entry.note: This can only be true if it is set. If it is not set, no value is returned.

entry.p: Playhead passes the 75% marker of video based on video length. Marker only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.
entry.note: This can only be true if it is set. If it is not set, no value is returned.

entry.p: Playhead passes the 95% marker of video based on video length. Marker only counted once, even if seeking backwards. If seeking forward, markers that are skipped are not counted.
entry.note: This can only be true if it is set. If it is not set, no value is returned.

ul.li: Sample value: Greater than or equal to 1

row.entry: The estimated number of video streams per each individual content. This value is increased for each 30 minutes of video play time (content + ads). Customers must create their own processing rules to have the value available for reporting.A stream is counted at every 30 minutes, based on the ms_s (or totalTimePlayed = Video Total Time), similar to: estimatedStreams = FLOOR(ms_s/1800) +1

entry.p: This value is either true or false. It is true if one or more pauses occurred during playback of a single video.
entry.note: This can only be true if it is set. If it is not set, no value is returned.

entry.p: This metric is computed as a count of pause periods that occurred during a playback session.
Sums the duration (in seconds) of all events of type PAUSE.
A Resume is counted for each playback that resumes after more than 30 minutes of buffer, pause, or stall period OR if this value is set by the player on the VideoInfo object before trackPlay.
entry.note: This can only be true if it is set. If it is not set, no value is returned.

entry.p: The number of views of the main content. A Content Segment View is counted when there is at least one frame viewed.
entry.note: This can only be true if it is set. If it is not set, no value is returned.

section.title: Ad Parameters
section.p: List of video ad data, including context data values, that Adobe collects via solution variables.

entry.p: Label
Implementation
Network Parameters
Reporting

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: Friendly name of the ad.
In reporting, "Ad Name" is the classification and "Ad Name (variable)" is the eVar.

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: ID of the ad. (Any integer and/or letter combination)

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: The position (index) of the ad inside the parent ad break. The first ad has index 0, the second ad has index 1, etc.

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: Length of video ad in seconds.

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: The name of the player responsible for rendering the ad.

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: The friendly name of the Ad Break.
The index of the ad break inside the content starting at 1. This property is used only by the VHL SDK to generate the Pod ID.

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: The offset of the ad break inside the content, in seconds.

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: Label
Implementation
Network Parameters
Reporting

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: Company/Brand whose product is featured in the ad.

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: ID of the ad campaign.

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: ID of the ad creative.

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: ID of the ad site.

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: URL of the ad creative.

ul.li: Sent with: Ad Start, Ad Close

entry.p: Placement ID of the ad.
Label
Implementation
Network Parameters
Reporting
Number of video ad starts.
Number of video ad completes.
The total amount of time, in seconds, spent watching the ad (i.e., the number of seconds played).

section.title: Chapter Parameters
section.p: List of chapter and/or segment data, including context data values, that Adobe collects via solution variables.

entry.p: Label
Implementation
Network Parameters
Reporting
The name of the chapter and/or segment.
The position (index, integer) of the chapter inside the content.
The offset of the chapter inside the content (in seconds) from the start.
The length of the chapter, in seconds.
The auto-generated ID of the chapter.
Label
Implementation
Network Parameters
Reporting
The number of chapter starts.
entry.note: If this event is set, the only possible value is TRUE. If this event is not set, no value is sent.

entry.p: The number of chapter completes.
entry.note: If this event is set, the only possible value is TRUE. If this event is not set, no value is sent.

entry.p: The time spent on the chapter.

section.title: Quality Parameters
section.p: List of quality of experience (QoE/Qos) data, including context data values, that Adobe collects via solution variables.

entry.p: Label
Implementation
Network Parameters
Reporting

The average bitrate (in kbps). The value is predefined buckets at 100kbps intervals. The Average Bitrate is computed as a weighted average of all bitrate values related to the play duration that occurred during a playback session

The amount of time (in seconds, integer) taken for the video to start. This metric is computed as the time difference between the time the viewer clicks Play and when the first frame was rendered. This value is taken from the last value of l:stream:startup_time and transformed into seconds.
The current value of the stream frame-rate (in frames per second).
The number of dropped frames (Integer). This value is computed as a sum of all frames dropped during a playback session.
This value is taken from the last value of l:stream:dropped_frames.
The number of buffer events. This metric is computed as a count of the different buffer states that occurred during a playback session.
This is a count of how many times the player enters a buffer state from other states, e.g., playing or pausing.
The total amount of time, in seconds, spent buffering. This value is computed as a sum of all buffer events durations that occurred during a playback session.
The number of bitrate changes (Integer). This value is computed as a sum of all bitrate change events that occurred during a playback session.
The number of errors occurred (Integer). This value is computed as a sum of all error events that occurred during a playback session.
Label
Implementation
Network Parameters
Reporting
The amount of time (in seconds) taken for the video to start. This metric is computed as the time difference between the time the viewer clicks Play and when the first frame was rendered.
We get the last value of l:stream:startup_time and transform it in seconds.
The number of buffer events (Integer). This metric is computed as a count of buffer events that occurred during a playback session.
The total amount of time spent buffering (seconds; integer). This value is computed as a sum of all buffer events durations that occurred during a playback session.
The number of bitrate changes. This value is computed as a sum of all bitrate change events that occurred during a playback session.
The number of errors occurred (Integer). This value is computed as a sum of all error events that occurred during a playback session.
The number of dropped frames (Integer). This value is computed as a sum of all frames dropped during a playback session.
The number of times a user quit the video before its start. This metric is set to 1 only if no content was rendered, regardless of ads.
entry.note: If this event is set, the only possible value is TRUE. If this event is not set, no value is sent.

entry.p: The number of streams impacted by buffering. This metric is set to 1 only if at least one buffer event occurred during a playback session.
entry.note: If this event is set, the only possible value is TRUE. If this event is not set, no value is sent.

entry.p: The number of streams in which bitrate changes occurred. This metric is set to 1 only if at least one bitrate change event occurred during a playback session.
entry.note: If this event is set, the only possible value is TRUE. If this event is not set, no value is sent.

entry.p: The average bitrate (in kbps, integer). This metric is computed as a weighted average of all bitrate values related to the play duration that occurred during a playback session.
The number of streams in which bitrate changes occurred. This metric is set to 1 only if at least one bitrate change event occurred during a playback session.
entry.note: If this event is set, the only possible value is TRUE. If this event is not set, no value is sent.

entry.p: The number of streams in which frames were dropped. This metric is set to 1 only if at least one frame was dropped during a playback session.
entry.note: If this event is set, the only possible value is TRUE. If this event is not set, no value is sent.

entry.p: The number of streams in which a stalled event occurred. This metric is set to 1 only if at least one stall occurred during playback. Customers will have to create their own processing rules to have the value available for reporting.
entry.note: If this event is set, the only possible value is TRUE. If this event is not set, no value is sent.

entry.p: The number of times the playback was stalled during a playback session. Customers will have to create their own processing rules to have the value available for reporting.
The total time (seconds; integer) the playback was stalled during a playback session. Customers will have to create their own processing rules to have the value available for reporting.
